[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-25 19:01:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/blockinfo.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_blockinfo.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Use the recreated disk.config.rescue during a rescue

I931421ea introduced a callback to _create_configdrive from
_create_domain during a rescue that recreates the config disk of an
instance with an additional .rescue suffix. However due to a latent bug
neither the original or this recreated config disk are mapped to the
instance during the resulting rescue.

To correct this disk.config.rescue is now added to the disk_mapping for
the instance if a config disk is required during a rescue.

Closes-bug: #1597669
Change-Id: I46cebd0612f50ff7373f677c4a002d444a877972
(cherry picked from commit 8795b206247fe2ca57f32c437d72c51492637649)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Use the recreated disk.config.rescue during a rescue

I931421ea introduced a callback to _create_configdrive from
_create_domain during a rescue that recreates the config disk of an
instance with an additional .rescue suffix. However due to a latent bug
neither the original or this recreated config disk are mapped to the
instance during the resulting rescue.

To correct this disk.config.rescue is now added to the disk_mapping for
the instance if a config disk is required during a rescue.

Closes-bug: #1597669
Change-Id: I46cebd0612f50ff7373f677c4a002d444a877972
(cherry picked from commit 8795b206247fe2ca57f32c437d72c51492637649)

The begin and end args format is timestamp in total-get command, which
is less convenient than date/time format(YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS). So this

Change-Id: Id83e132e6b8a090d1abfa3002d53de1b678fc9f2

commit_message:
Change the time args format from timestamp to date/time when total-get

The begin and end args format is timestamp in total-get command, which
is less convenient than date/time format(YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS). So this
patch make it easy to use.

Change-Id: Id83e132e6b8a090d1abfa3002d53de1b678fc9f2

commit_message:
The inconsistency of delete method between restore API and client

In the restore module in karbor-client component,there exists
delete(restore_id) that calls delete(path), but I can't find any
delete method in restore API module.

Closes-Bug:#1624841

Change-Id: I507c677b141d72b57d52fd6b653cc8a652a103bf

commit_message:
Add tests on upgrade murano plugin via new version

This patch adding tests for upgrade fuel murano plugin via new version
of the plugin. The logic of tests is:
1. deploy env with old version of the murano plugin
2. install and enable new version of the murano plugin
3. deploy chages(upgrade murano plugin)
4. run OSTF

Change-Id: I096d53e776ab49133bae22a7b6c3a5e39faf75f0

commit_message:
Implemet PIPESTATUS env var to handle error correctly.

As tar is here piped into openssl, we only get the return code for
openssl and lose the one of tar. This patch fixes this issue using
bash PIPESTATUS variable.

The piped command now returns return code of tar if openssl succeeds.
Otherwise it returns return code of openssl. That means, both the
commands should succeed.

Change-Id: I6f9de52539f7284d9479805fc4ca478f2ffd9123
Closes-Bug: #1596587

commit_message:
Change predicate to detect legacy stages for role-based emulation

Legacy tasks adapter checks if there are pre- and post- deployment
stages for role-based emulation using in predicate. Unfortunately,
it is broken due to legacy orchestrator graph constructor
implementation and retunrs false positive results.
Instead we should use safe get that works properly.

Change-Id: I22d216af9933250c473c1ccfaa931d0b41cfb1f2
Closes-bug: #1635051

commit_message:
Change predicate to detect legacy stages for role-based emulation

Legacy tasks adapter checks if there are pre- and post- deployment
stages for role-based emulation using in predicate. Unfortunately,
it is broken due to legacy orchestrator graph constructor
implementation and retunrs false positive results.
Instead we should use safe get that works properly.

Change-Id: I22d216af9933250c473c1ccfaa931d0b41cfb1f2
Closes-bug: #1635051
(cherry picked from commit efdd063170062d1bc881cd31c52bcee08bcdc9ee)

commit_message:
Remove liberty tempest jobs

With the liberty branch going EOL [1] we no longer need to run
liberty jobs.
liberty jobs are voting on check pipeline on tempest and its blocking
gate currently.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-December/108697.html

Change-Id: I2654e354ff8ab6f8e3ee64a00219aa8070da3936

However, it is difficult to find the corresponding patches when facing test

commit_message:
Add test.related_bug() to know launchpad bug reports

We(QA-team) have added some tests into Tempest for reproducing bugs on the
gate and applied the corresponding patches into multiple branches. This kind
of tests are useful for production clouds also because they can know latent
bugs of their own clouds from the test failures.
However, it is difficult to find the corresponding patches when facing test
failures now because testers need to search the git history of the failed test
and find the bug number from "Related-Bug" tag from the commit message.
This patch adds a new decorator to know launchpad bug reports more easily.

In addition, this patch puts the decorator to test_delete_attached_volume
as a sample becauuse the test can detect the server internal error which
makes operations harder on productions.

Change-Id: Idc9ac0ebc61e230e4e014fb6476d1c74116511f7

subject: Replace retrying with tenacity
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-12-14 17:16:02.000000000', 'files': ['aodh/storage/__init__.py', 'aodh/tests/functional/storage/test_get_connection.py', 'requirements.txt', 'aodh/coordination.py'], 'message': "Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Co-Authored-By: gordon chung <gord@live.ca>
Closes-Bug: #1635402
Change-Id: Ife452b18709ff34ec48a39bbe5407d69a5b2e3c2
"}]
commit_message:
Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Co-Authored-By: gordon chung <gord@live.ca>
Closes-Bug: #1635402
Change-Id: Ife452b18709ff34ec48a39bbe5407d69a5b2e3c2

commit_message:
Remove upgrade from non-ironic setup

Grenade should only upgrade, and shouldn't setup new services,
remove setup code for case inspector is missing during upgrade.

Also ironic doesn't support this anymore, related code was removed
Id7159aac8c8a343e3d20561cedc4722d87d3e776.

Change-Id: I867215574af7135103876d8004241761a5e2c683

performed the same action as the zero option.

subject: ovs, extraroute: unbreak a1b21e34009eaf4170bed122e92c57d17f8e8930
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-14 20:11:11.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/extraroute_db.py'], 'message': 'ovs, extraroute: unbreak a1b21e34009eaf4170bed122e92c57d17f8e8930

The changeset of a1b21e34009eaf4170bed122e92c57d17f8e8930
commit id of I2439116abf051d0e19821ba53895fa0c724f6a96
breaks networking-odl. The breakage is blocking networking-odl.

ExtraRoute_dbonly_mixin._make_extra_route_list returns
wrong results. the results should be
{"destination": python-string, "nexthop": python-string},
it returns IPNetworkField, instead of python string.
This patch unbreak it by converting IPNetworkField into string.

Change-Id: I9cc4152955565078ddfe427f560d0686d1b30ee0
Closes-Bug: #1649993
Closes-Bug: #1650002
'}]
commit_message:
ovs, extraroute: unbreak a1b21e34009eaf4170bed122e92c57d17f8e8930

The changeset of a1b21e34009eaf4170bed122e92c57d17f8e8930
commit id of I2439116abf051d0e19821ba53895fa0c724f6a96
breaks networking-odl. The breakage is blocking networking-odl.

ExtraRoute_dbonly_mixin._make_extra_route_list returns
wrong results. the results should be
{"destination": python-string, "nexthop": python-string},
it returns IPNetworkField, instead of python string.
This patch unbreak it by converting IPNetworkField into string.

Change-Id: I9cc4152955565078ddfe427f560d0686d1b30ee0
Closes-Bug: #1649993
Closes-Bug: #1650002

subject: Ensure the exist of writer path
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-15 08:16:07.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/write_orchestrator.py'], 'message': 'Ensure the exist of writer path

When the writer path does not exist, the cloudkitty-writer will
fail when trying to create file in writer path.
And the cloudkitty also does not ensure the exist of default
path(/var/lib/cloudkitty/states/).
This patch ensure the writer path always exists.

Change-Id: Ic9ed41482615e405d6f99a3148e7d220e4c64260
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure the exist of writer path

When the writer path does not exist, the cloudkitty-writer will
fail when trying to create file in writer path.
And the cloudkitty also does not ensure the exist of default
path(/var/lib/cloudkitty/states/).
This patch ensure the writer path always exists.

Change-Id: Ic9ed41482615e405d6f99a3148e7d220e4c64260

subject: snaps: Add OpenStack Snap package repos
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-14 08:09:24.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/snaps.config', 'jenkins/jobs/snap-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'snaps: Add OpenStack Snap package repos

Snap packages provide an alternative distribution semantic to
deb or rpm packages; A snap typically contains a services and
the majority of its dependencies, and by default will run in
an AppArmor and Seccomp confined snapbox, with limited access
to the host OS filesystem and other system resources.

Snaps (and the services then encapsulate) are given permission
to access host OS services, and services provided from other
snaps using interfaces (modelled as sockets and plugs).

This commit covers a minimal set of Snap package definitions
for OpenStack, and a small supporting library to help build out
Oslo config command line arguments for OpenStack daemons.

Change-Id: If010226a843908319b158f78eb25ecb520add3ab
'}]
commit_message:
snaps: Add OpenStack Snap package repos

Snap packages provide an alternative distribution semantic to
deb or rpm packages; A snap typically contains a services and
the majority of its dependencies, and by default will run in
an AppArmor and Seccomp confined snapbox, with limited access
to the host OS filesystem and other system resources.

Snaps (and the services then encapsulate) are given permission
to access host OS services, and services provided from other
snaps using interfaces (modelled as sockets and plugs).

This commit covers a minimal set of Snap package definitions
for OpenStack, and a small supporting library to help build out
Oslo config command line arguments for OpenStack daemons.

Change-Id: If010226a843908319b158f78eb25ecb520add3ab

commit_message:
Make ...ironic-pxe_ipmitool-pyghmi-src-ubuntu-xenial voting

This patch is making the
"gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ipmitool-pyghmi-src-ubuntu-xenial" voting.

Ironic is becoming more dependent on pyghmi because it relies on the
pyghmi code to test the dpeloyment of the nodes using the pxe_ipmitool
driver in gate, so, let's make this job voting to avoid changes in
pyghmi to break Ironic.

Change-Id: I671e281a875b1a109c6a8dcdda37bec65002bca4

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-14 15:26:53.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "neutron: switch experimental centos job to single node

As was revealed in comments to
I8d63a883b29eda2757656008be3c6af83b8f9e88, CentOS is not stable for
multinode gate setups just yet, so an attempt to make it work for
Neutron is probably too big a bite for us.

Instead, let's scale back and try a single node, no DVR job and see if
we can make it work. If we suceed with it, we can look at
expanding/replacing it with a dvr flavour.

Change-Id: Ida69e44c38fc2f91eaff121b3078004d8b376808
"}]
commit_message:
neutron: switch experimental centos job to single node

As was revealed in comments to
I8d63a883b29eda2757656008be3c6af83b8f9e88, CentOS is not stable for
multinode gate setups just yet, so an attempt to make it work for
Neutron is probably too big a bite for us.

Instead, let's scale back and try a single node, no DVR job and see if
we can make it work. If we suceed with it, we can look at
expanding/replacing it with a dvr flavour.

Change-Id: Ida69e44c38fc2f91eaff121b3078004d8b376808

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-14 15:49:13.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "Add identity v3 test accounts job

The pre-provisioned credential provider (aka test accounts) in
Tempest supports both identity v2 and v3, but it's mostly tested
with idenity v2.

Adding an identity v3 test account job to make sure that we don't
break preprovisioned credentials for v3. Eventually the aim is to
move one of tempest main check/gate jobs to use pre-provisioned
credentials.

Note that I lost 'neutron' and 'full' in the name, since the job
name was getting too long, and both terms are legacy now - any
new job will be a neutron one I believe, and all tempest
check/gate jobs are full runs unless specified otherwise.

Change-Id: I07eb520fb54fc264547a0869208ad29e958c2793
"}]
commit_message:
Add identity v3 test accounts job

The pre-provisioned credential provider (aka test accounts) in
Tempest supports both identity v2 and v3, but it's mostly tested
with idenity v2.

Adding an identity v3 test account job to make sure that we don't
break preprovisioned credentials for v3. Eventually the aim is to
move one of tempest main check/gate jobs to use pre-provisioned
credentials.

Note that I lost 'neutron' and 'full' in the name, since the job
name was getting too long, and both terms are legacy now - any
new job will be a neutron one I believe, and all tempest
check/gate jobs are full runs unless specified otherwise.

Change-Id: I07eb520fb54fc264547a0869208ad29e958c2793

commit_message:
Liberty spring cleaning

Liberty is EOL, start cleaning up all of the special things we have in
place for handling libertyisms. Note that this doesn't touch the configs
for deployment projects as they may still attempt to support liberty via
distro packages.

Change-Id: I7faa16c1d6038204a4b42167ed91b73175abe58c

The 0.13.1 release breaks some documentation jobs when it tries to build
docs with remote images. This has been reported upstream[0]. The version
matches the supported docutils versions for sphinx.

The requirements patch is here: [1]

[0] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/

commit_message:
Pin docutils version

The 0.13.1 release breaks some documentation jobs when it tries to build
docs with remote images. This has been reported upstream[0]. The version
matches the supported docutils versions for sphinx.

The requirements patch is here: [1]

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/843eccc9ac3877a0565624becd670d31

Change-Id: I8296730aba26fd42528d3ea0f318871c381d489a

commit_message:
Fix dos-style endlines

Hacking rules require that files end with unix-style endlines.

To review this change, try:
 $ git show HEAD --ignore-space-at-eol

Change-Id: I0db934c7fa2e3611478bae1e7432f2bb5bd95170

commit_message:
Use curl instead of wget in setup-kubectl.sh

Generally curl is installed in linux system while wget is not, it
would be better to use curl instead of wget.

commit_message:
Revert "Turn off angular template cache preloading when DEBUG=True"

This completely breaks schema form. If you want
to reduce cache time, just use the existing setting

This reverts commit d219f6078b315048b770e1f0c420dce6ad4f6ec9.

Change-Id: I74c5f860ffe9423b7d9d09fb42faabae546fd0c7

subject: Use liberty-eol tag for liberty release notes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-15 03:02:19.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/liberty.rst'], 'message': "Use liberty-eol tag for liberty release notes

reno doesn't currently handle missing branches so we need
to use the liberty-eol tag to fix the release note job in
the gate now that origin/stable/liberty is gone.

reno will eventually check for the -eol tag when a stable
branch isn't found [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/410839/

Change-Id: Ie3c0447aba3fce895a1f17c68f773b40aa90bf00
"}]
commit_message:
Use liberty-eol tag for liberty release notes

reno doesn't currently handle missing branches so we need
to use the liberty-eol tag to fix the release note job in
the gate now that origin/stable/liberty is gone.

reno will eventually check for the -eol tag when a stable
branch isn't found [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/410839/

Change-Id: Ie3c0447aba3fce895a1f17c68f773b40aa90bf00

Change-Id: Ie3c0447aba3fce895a1f17c68f773b40aa90bf00
"}]
commit_message:
Use liberty-eol tag for liberty release notes

reno doesn't currently handle missing branches so we need
to use the liberty-eol tag to fix the release note job in
the gate now that origin/stable/liberty is gone.

reno will eventually check for the -eol tag when a stable
branch isn't found [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/410839/

Change-Id: Ie3c0447aba3fce895a1f17c68f773b40aa90bf00

subject: [TEST DNM] Unpin qemu-kvm-ev version in CentOS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-15 08:55:29.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "[TEST DNM] Unpin qemu-kvm-ev version in CentOS

The original pin was caused by a dependency issue, where ipxe-roms-qemu >= 20160127-4 was not available in the repos. It is actually available, so let's check if it was a repo sync issue or we need to clean yum metadata in the image.

This reverts commit b7166681864f30099ad51b05f1c1595c22b7728e.

Change-Id: I1f324bc76ec72a842d2ce4ec4cbd48fd4994e950
"}]
commit_message:
[TEST DNM] Unpin qemu-kvm-ev version in CentOS

The original pin was caused by a dependency issue, where ipxe-roms-qemu >= 20160127-4 was not available in the repos. It is actually available, so let's check if it was a repo sync issue or we need to clean yum metadata in the image.

This reverts commit b7166681864f30099ad51b05f1c1595c22b7728e.

Change-Id: I1f324bc76ec72a842d2ce4ec4cbd48fd4994e950

commit_message:
Moved README.rst content to installation.rst doc

Changeset https://review.openstack.org/#/c/402973/ will introduce
a new badge for this project, including a external svg image. This
update will produce a bug because README.rst file is referenced by
the deploy/installation.rst file. So I moved README.rst content to
deploy/installation.rst to fix it.

Change-Id: I4074baba8e1fea67410710b6565374dcb927e7a2

commit_message:
Add dependencies for UI internationalisation

This patch adds new dependencies needed for i18n features. All three new
packages are part of the tooling or build process.

The new packages are:

- babel-plugin-react-intl (BSD-3-Clause License)
  https://github.com/yahoo/babel-plugin-react-intl
- json-loader (MIT License)
  https://github.com/webpack/json-loader
- react-intl-po (MIT License)
  https://github.com/evenchange4/react-intl-po

Note: The general change of the `format` metadata fields in the
shrinkwrap file is due to how shrinkwrap handles first vs. subsequent
runs.

Implements: blueprint tripleo-ui-i18n-support-for-js
Change-Id: I7c5b6e7eb8c72a6cfecb973960277fce9e74723d

subject: Unit test for checking that migrations don't cause downtime
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-19 08:15:35.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/db/test_migrations.py'], 'message': "Unit test for checking that migrations don't cause downtime

Future incompatible changes in sqlalchemy models, like removing,
renaming columns and tables can break rolling upgrades (upgrades when
Heat services are run at different versions simultaneously). This
patch bans chema changes which cause incompatibilities - specifically
drops and alters.

After this test is merged, we can be sure that schema migrations can
be done online, allowing for rolling upgrades.

Change-Id: I2722577a2316d76017a0769a435e816a499c84b3
Closes-Bug: #1505974
"}]
commit_message:
Unit test for checking that migrations don't cause downtime

Future incompatible changes in sqlalchemy models, like removing,
renaming columns and tables can break rolling upgrades (upgrades when
Heat services are run at different versions simultaneously). This
patch bans chema changes which cause incompatibilities - specifically
drops and alters.

After this test is merged, we can be sure that schema migrations can
be done online, allowing for rolling upgrades.

Change-Id: I2722577a2316d76017a0769a435e816a499c84b3
Closes-Bug: #1505974

commit_message:
Add FreeIPA enrollment environment generator

This is based on previous work [1] and it's what I've been using to
test the TLS-everywhere work.

This is a convenience tool that will generate an environment file
that sets the override in the resource registry as well as the
relevant parameters that will be needed in a TLS-everywhere deployment.

[1] https://github.com/JAORMX/freeipa-tripleo-incubator

bp tls-via-certmonger

Change-Id: If3e6cb1dde235b24a0c188eb758f9a2e6a626f69

subject: Wait for port to finish building when getting server ip
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 5690, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11869, 'name': 'zhubingbing', 'email': 'zhu.bingbing@99cloud.net', 'username': 'zhubingbing'}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13404, 'name': 'Alberto Planas', 'email': 'aplanas@gmail.com', 'username': 'aplanas'}, {'_account_id': 16437, 'name': 'Anna Babich', 'email': 'anna.v.babich@gmail.com', 'username': 'ababich'}, {'_account_id': 20190, 'name': 'zhufl', 'email': 'zhu.fanglei@zte.com.cn', 'username': 'zhufl'}, {'_account_id': 23204, 'name': 'Jonte Watford', 'email': 'jonte.watford@intel.com', 'username': 'jwatford'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-11-02 01:26:36.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py'], 'message': 'Wait for port to finish building when getting server ip

<_get_server_port_id_and_ip4> when port's status is 'BUILD'
will raise "AssertionError:
   "No IPv4 addresses found in: [{u'status': u'BUILD', ...}]"
because no port 'ACTIVE' found.

So this is to wait for port to finish building and end up with
status 'ACTIVE' when ironic is not available.
Besides, we shouldn't stop waiting when port status is 'DOWN',
because it is hard to say  whether the case is port finishing
building and ending up with status 'DOWN', or is port not having
begun the procedure of activating. And we also shouldn't stop
waiting when there is port 'ERROR', because maybe there are
other ports that are not 'ERROR'.

Change-Id: I97e112e7cb51036bc6a746a149de82e391e35d5e
Closes-Bug: #1621337
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for port to finish building when getting server ip

<_get_server_port_id_and_ip4> when port's status is 'BUILD'
will raise "AssertionError:
   "No IPv4 addresses found in: [{u'status': u'BUILD', ...}]"
because no port 'ACTIVE' found.

So this is to wait for port to finish building and end up with
status 'ACTIVE' when ironic is not available.
Besides, we shouldn't stop waiting when port status is 'DOWN',
because it is hard to say  whether the case is port finishing
building and ending up with status 'DOWN', or is port not having
begun the procedure of activating. And we also shouldn't stop
waiting when there is port 'ERROR', because maybe there are
other ports that are not 'ERROR'.

Change-Id: I97e112e7cb51036bc6a746a149de82e391e35d5e
Closes-Bug: #1621337

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-27 08:32:31.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/test.py'], 'message': "Get tenant_id filled when using pre-provisioned credentials

Now when using pre-provisioned credentials, validating is not
done until client sends its first request
(Change-Id: I825a01ff72cb3a937aafeb2104333db7113ef4d0). There
must be some reason for that modification so we shouldn't just
revert it, but that will make some testcases fail unexpectedly.

commit_message:
Get tenant_id filled when using pre-provisioned credentials

Now when using pre-provisioned credentials, validating is not
done until client sends its first request
(Change-Id: I825a01ff72cb3a937aafeb2104333db7113ef4d0). There
must be some reason for that modification so we shouldn't just
revert it, but that will make some testcases fail unexpectedly.
So this is to use set_auth to get tenant_id filled in
setup_credentials. This is a temporary solution

Change-Id: I2530c4c405d097e960dacd50efe1c933dd09c740
Closes-Bug: #1606096

subject: Support packet sequence wrong error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-14 17:45:32.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/exc_filters.py', 'oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py'], 'message': 'Support packet sequence wrong error

In I484237c28a83783689bb8484152476de33f20e3a, we observed
MariaDB-specific error code 1927 as a new kind of disconnect situation.
In some failure-mode testing we are also observing with PyMySQL that
a stale connection, when it is attempted to be used for the initial
ping, does not return any error code but instead trips up
PyMySQL with packets sequence numbers (this is an internal value
used by the MySQL client/server protocol to track messages).
The connection is definitely not recoverable in this state so this also
needs to be a disconnect situation so that the ping listener refreshes
the connection pool.

Change-Id: Iee1c4533e2457acc30e2046b63145c2502012c5f
References: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1642944
'}]
commit_message:
Support packet sequence wrong error

In I484237c28a83783689bb8484152476de33f20e3a, we observed
MariaDB-specific error code 1927 as a new kind of disconnect situation.
In some failure-mode testing we are also observing with PyMySQL that
a stale connection, when it is attempted to be used for the initial
ping, does not return any error code but instead trips up
PyMySQL with packets sequence numbers (this is an internal value
used by the MySQL client/server protocol to track messages).
The connection is definitely not recoverable in this state so this also
needs to be a disconnect situation so that the ping listener refreshes
the connection pool.

Change-Id: Iee1c4533e2457acc30e2046b63145c2502012c5f
References: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1642944

commit_message:
Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: I5111eb95ceacc4900969dc60d8e67c79b805cab8

commit_message:
Restore extraroute dict after OVO change

A recently merged OVO change [1] made the dict have netaddr objects.
This change restores plain strings so that it can be JSON
serializable again.

[1] I2439116abf051d0e19821ba53895fa0c724f6a96

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Closes-Bug: #1649733

OpenStack's workflow includes a step to remove a stable branch when the
version is marked for end-of-life. At that point we add a $name-eol tag
to replace the branch. Update the reference searching logic to support
this to avoid breaking release notes builds at that point.

Change-Id: I49734fbf4c3499e148367c9b6dd6f4f49ba17956
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
support removed stable branches

OpenStack's workflow includes a step to remove a stable branch when the
version is marked for end-of-life. At that point we add a $name-eol tag
to replace the branch. Update the reference searching logic to support
this to avoid breaking release notes builds at that point.

Change-Id: I49734fbf4c3499e148367c9b6dd6f4f49ba17956
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: traversal performance improvements
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-13 19:06:32.000000000', 'files': ['reno/scanner.py', 'reno/tests/test_scanner.py'], 'message': "traversal performance improvements

Only compute the differences in the subdirectory where notes are stored,
not the entire tree. The subtree diff is faster to compute, and lets us
ignore commits that aren't interesting to us.

These changes reduced the scan time for the master branch of
openstack/nova from 5:33 to 0:32.

Change-Id: Ic85b873ad353b3652717c9807ad5f69c473d8c60
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
traversal performance improvements

Only compute the differences in the subdirectory where notes are stored,
not the entire tree. The subtree diff is faster to compute, and lets us
ignore commits that aren't interesting to us.

These changes reduced the scan time for the master branch of
openstack/nova from 5:33 to 0:32.

Change-Id: Ic85b873ad353b3652717c9807ad5f69c473d8c60
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
set up logging in the sphinx extension

We have logging throughout the scanner, but Sphinx doesn't set up
logging. We can do that when our extension is loaded.

This change also modifies the log levels for a couple of messages.

commit_message:
Make Kafka listen on all interfaces

It seems that even if host.name is configured with IPv4,
Kafka still listens on IPv6 (if available). As a consequence
in some scenarios (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409144/
Patch-Set 13) some services are unable to connect to Kafka.

Change-Id: I12be88eac41edefde8b3936f4a92de4f636907d9

subject: use dulwich to implement get_notes_by_version
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-13 16:36:56.000000000', 'files': ['reno/scanner.py', 'reno/tests/test_scanner.py'], 'message': "use dulwich to implement get_notes_by_version

Replace the use of git-log with a traversal of the dulwich history. The
topo ordering in dulwich does not match the git command line output, so
we have our own in _topo_traversal(). I'll try to upstream that
separately.

Use the _aggregate_changes() method from the previous commit to turn a
given commit into the set of changes to make to the note history.

The topo sort in dulwich relied too much on the date ordering, which
means the entries were sometimes produced in the right order and
sometimes the wrong order.  The issue is better exposed when the commits
have more significant time differences, so add a sleep to the tests
after committing and after merging to ensure that repo changes have
distinct timestamps.

Remove the skip from the test that exposed the issue with the git
porcelain output format change to show that the new implementation
passes the test.

Since we're no longer scanning the git log history, we no longer need
the TAG_RE regex.

Change-Id: Ibfa1249f9d56a9e27b5a9f435ac8033f4bae24b6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
use dulwich to implement get_notes_by_version

Replace the use of git-log with a traversal of the dulwich history. The
topo ordering in dulwich does not match the git command line output, so
we have our own in _topo_traversal(). I'll try to upstream that
separately.

Use the _aggregate_changes() method from the previous commit to turn a
given commit into the set of changes to make to the note history.

The topo sort in dulwich relied too much on the date ordering, which
means the entries were sometimes produced in the right order and
sometimes the wrong order.  The issue is better exposed when the commits
have more significant time differences, so add a sleep to the tests
after committing and after merging to ensure that repo changes have
distinct timestamps.

Remove the skip from the test that exposed the issue with the git
porcelain output format change to show that the new implementation
passes the test.

Since we're no longer scanning the git log history, we no longer need
the TAG_RE regex.

Change-Id: Ibfa1249f9d56a9e27b5a9f435ac8033f4bae24b6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Merge v20 view builder for limit API

Now v2 and v2.1 code is merged and we do not need
to maintain the different set of view builder.
Previously there were different way of building the
complete response for limit API. v2 used to do with extension
and v2.1 with view builder itself.

Change-Id: I79fc803f471c9810c413d1b2983dc13763fa4633

commit_message:
Add preload wsgi script option

This, as stated in the documentation, specifies the same wsgi script
that we use for the application to be loaded when the vhost starts.
This is then used to reduce the time that apache takes to lazy load
the vhost's resources.

Change-Id: Id7665d27654d586eb7f3c25e8a80512e2224c4a0

subject: Allow compute driver to load correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-15 05:05:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/__init__.py'], 'message': "Allow compute driver to load correctly

In certain environments the load order can be confused between nova
and zun. This can cause boot issues where 'No module named cmd.compute'
can be thrown because the python code is looking in zun/nova for that
driver.

This change extends the declare_namespace code to allow for the other
projects to properly load.

Similar fix: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311724/

Closes-Bug: #1650107
Change-Id: Ibb12f73a378dcc30a0483422226f57d52b53fde9
"}]
commit_message:
Allow compute driver to load correctly

In certain environments the load order can be confused between nova
and zun. This can cause boot issues where 'No module named cmd.compute'
can be thrown because the python code is looking in zun/nova for that
driver.

This change extends the declare_namespace code to allow for the other
projects to properly load.

Similar fix: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311724/

Closes-Bug: #1650107
Change-Id: Ibb12f73a378dcc30a0483422226f57d52b53fde9

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-11-15 06:04:13.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/base.py'], 'message': "Use __slots__ for save memory of drivers

In default, Python uses a dict to store an object's instance attributes.
The dict wastes a lot of RAM. Python can't just allocate a static amount
of memory at object creation to store all the attributes. Here is an
example showing exact memory usage with and without __slots__ done in
IPython using ipython_memory_usage.ipython_memory_usage [1]. I use
__slots__ to tell Python not to use a dict, and only allocate space for
a fixed set of attributes is tuple instead of dict. We can probably
define __slots__ on the driver class to reduce memory.[2]

[1]http://book.pythontips.com/en/latest/__slots__magic.html
[2]https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/not-implemented/driver-composition-reform.html#performance-impact

Change-Id: Ic7232f46c96599313011b0c7489b09cefbe93ae5
Partial-Bug: #1524745
"}]
commit_message:
Use __slots__ for save memory of drivers

In default, Python uses a dict to store an object's instance attributes.
The dict wastes a lot of RAM. Python can't just allocate a static amount
of memory at object creation to store all the attributes. Here is an
example showing exact memory usage with and without __slots__ done in
IPython using ipython_memory_usage.ipython_memory_usage [1]. I use
__slots__ to tell Python not to use a dict, and only allocate space for
a fixed set of attributes is tuple instead of dict. We can probably
define __slots__ on the driver class to reduce memory.[2]

[1]http://book.pythontips.com/en/latest/__slots__magic.html
[2]https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/not-implemented/driver-composition-reform.html#performance-impact

Change-Id: Ic7232f46c96599313011b0c7489b09cefbe93ae5
Partial-Bug: #1524745

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-07 17:24:31.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/glance/handlers/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/glance/tasks/config.yml'], 'message': 'Implement only restart the container which configuration changed

In parent implement, if the glance-api container is changed (like adding
an environment), both glance-api and glance-registry will be
restarted/recreate.

In this implement, if the glance-registry will not be restart.

This implement is more optimal, but more complication, especially for
big service, like nova and neturon. no idea whether it is worth.

Change-Id: I4ad70b07dbd7c3d552cf267112fbe879e0076dfc
'}]
commit_message:
Implement only restart the container which configuration changed

In parent implement, if the glance-api container is changed (like adding
an environment), both glance-api and glance-registry will be
restarted/recreate.

In this implement, if the glance-registry will not be restart.

This implement is more optimal, but more complication, especially for
big service, like nova and neturon. no idea whether it is worth.

Change-Id: I4ad70b07dbd7c3d552cf267112fbe879e0076dfc

subject: Always set all socket timeouts
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 1970, 'name': 'Jacob Wen', 'email': 'wenjianhn@gmail.com', 'username': 'wenjianhn'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 8601, 'name': 'Dmitriy Ukhlov', 'email': 'dukhlov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dukhlov'}, {'_account_id': 9257, 'name': 'John Eckersberg', 'email': 'jeckersb@redhat.com', 'username': 'jeckersb'}, {'_account_id': 13290, 'name': 'Oleksii Zamiatin', 'email': 'ozamiatin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ozamiatin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-03-21 15:56:16.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "Always set all socket timeouts

When exchange/queue are declared the timeout is the default (None)
when it should be the no more than heartbeat timeout.

Also we have to set TCP_USER_TIMEOUT to ensure our timeouts are
respected. socket.settimeout() of python relies on select() that can
be blocked because kernel doesn't return during a recv() because of
TCP connection breakage.

This change fixes that by always setting TCP_USER_TIMEOUT and python
socket timeout each time the connection is establish.

Change-Id: Ibf6139ac2c22d9eeda7030fb87b7f1139d92332e
"}]
commit_message:
Always set all socket timeouts

When exchange/queue are declared the timeout is the default (None)
when it should be the no more than heartbeat timeout.

Also we have to set TCP_USER_TIMEOUT to ensure our timeouts are
respected. socket.settimeout() of python relies on select() that can
be blocked because kernel doesn't return during a recv() because of
TCP connection breakage.

This change fixes that by always setting TCP_USER_TIMEOUT and python
socket timeout each time the connection is establish.

Change-Id: Ibf6139ac2c22d9eeda7030fb87b7f1139d92332e

commit_message:
Deployed server: switch to apply-config hook

This patch switches the deployed-server.yaml template to use
apply-config instead of os-apply-config. The 'apply-config' hook
is now installed via a package (no longer requires elements for
installation) and supports more signalling options.

This is required to support the undercloud installer which doesn't work
with os-collect-config heat metadata.

Change-Id: I7963fe4f38e8f04c9871fe651d39efec1aa17c41

'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20040, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V Compute CI', 'email': 'microsoft_nova_ci@microsoft.com', revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-12-14 12:23:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/server_tags.py', 'api-ref/source/os-server-tags.inc', 'nova/api/validation/parameter_types.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_server_tags.py'], 'message': 'Stop allowing tags as empty string

Nova support tagging of instance or other resource like device etc.
But those tags are allowed to be as empty string which does not make
much sense or any real use case.

Updating single tag with empty string is not possible as it will
be 404 due to url itself has single tag as id.

But updating all tags with few or all of them as empty string
does not complain. In those cases, empty tags are being accepted and
stored as same.

Main issue with those is that empty tag cannot be deleted/show as single
tag as it will again 404 with url not found. Only way to delete/show
such tag is to delete all together.

Empty tag should not be allowed at first.
This commit makes empty string request to 400 which are
currently 200. Doing for server and device tags and same can
be adopted for other resource tagging also if any in future.

Fixing this as bug fix hoping no backward incompatibility
logically. If such tag could have been deleted alone then we could have
fix this with microversion.

Change-Id: I18a81f19205b2a40ca470067a9576f2f72ff0f13
Closes-Bug: #1648663
'}]
commit_message:
Stop allowing tags as empty string

Nova support tagging of instance or other resource like device etc.
But those tags are allowed to be as empty string which does not make
much sense or any real use case.

Updating single tag with empty string is not possible as it will
be 404 due to url itself has single tag as id.

But updating all tags with few or all of them as empty string
does not complain. In those cases, empty tags are being accepted and
stored as same.

Main issue with those is that empty tag cannot be deleted/show as single
tag as it will again 404 with url not found. Only way to delete/show
such tag is to delete all together.

Empty tag should not be allowed at first.
This commit makes empty string request to 400 which are
currently 200. Doing for server and device tags and same can
be adopted for other resource tagging also if any in future.

Fixing this as bug fix hoping no backward incompatibility
logically. If such tag could have been deleted alone then we could have
fix this with microversion.

Change-Id: I18a81f19205b2a40ca470067a9576f2f72ff0f13
Closes-Bug: #1648663

commit_message:
Fix typo installation guide

1. What is the problem?
There were some typos in the title of installation guide that could
raises errors for documentation generator tools, e. g. sphinix.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
This change fixes the typo and format of the title and change the
plural for the environments referred in the installation guide.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution?
No new features

commit_message:
Wait for identity endpoint instead of sleeping

* added a small ruby block with a loop to check if the keystonen admin
  endpoint is up before trying to register projects, users etc.
* will wait 60 seconds for admin endpoint to become ready and raise
  error specific exception otherwise if Timeout::Error was raised

Change-Id: Ief678b0f40685e91ced9bddde95b916f4587b330

commit_message:
Remove Ubuntu Trusty Support

OpenStack projects in general have stopped testing on Trusty
in Newton. The Ubuntu distribution is not implementing any
of the required distribution binaries that OpenStack depends
on for Newton and above on Trusty.

As a result of these factors, OpenStack-Ansible is dropping
Trusty support in Ocata.

Change-Id: I65801948506f5631689a6ef748dad26f13df3c12
Related-Bug: #1644349

subject: Revert "Use liberty-eol tag for liberty release notes"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-15 02:09:58.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/liberty.rst'], 'message': 'Revert "Use liberty-eol tag for liberty release notes"

This reverts commit 4a237c02e43dbefb61a1b1f34b3e268593b5061a

reno 1.9.0 has a bug which doesn't handle using an -eol tag
as the branch, because it transforms it blindly into something
like liberty-eol-eol which doesn't exist.

As we're coming up on the ocata-2 milestone and need to get
some release notes in for the beta tag, we need to just
revert this change to make things work with reno 1.9.0.

Change-Id: I081e79245ccb45eaddb9b3cbe2868685628b7304
Related-Bug: #1650089
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Use liberty-eol tag for liberty release notes"

This reverts commit 4a237c02e43dbefb61a1b1f34b3e268593b5061a

reno 1.9.0 has a bug which doesn't handle using an -eol tag
as the branch, because it transforms it blindly into something
like liberty-eol-eol which doesn't exist.

As we're coming up on the ocata-2 milestone and need to get
some release notes in for the beta tag, we need to just
revert this change to make things work with reno 1.9.0.

Change-Id: I081e79245ccb45eaddb9b3cbe2868685628b7304
Related-Bug: #1650089

commit_message:
Dell SC: Unable to locate LV primary after LV-AFO

The Dell SC driver does not always locate the LV primary
after an LV-AFO event. The details in the LiveVolume object
returned by the DSM after an LV-AFO event can vary depending
on state and SCOS versions.

In the case that where the LV has failed over, the secondary
is active and no primary volume is returned in the LV object,
the driver now returns the proper LV object.

Closes-Bug: #1645506
Change-Id: I4ebcf1e1030425855bd873e5a4c2305a3519ee2e

commit_message:
Fix an error message for validate_values

This commit shows valid values as an error message when a user specified
wrong value as follows. The user will be able to understand what to set.

  * Before: hoge is not in valid_values.
  * After:  hoge is not in '['fuga', 'piyo']'.

Change-Id: I07b7640af70a6dfe28d104dcf639e195162cfbe9
Closes-Bug: #1649885

subject: Fix unit tests for LVM migration with os-brick 1.7.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-07 23:50:09.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'Fix unit tests for LVM migration with os-brick 1.7.0

Commit a9f50dd3823ea2e9c568a1fdd970e268955dca9f in os-brick 1.7.0
introduced the usage of safe_decode() of the results of CLI commands.
This revealed that two unit tests in Cinder use a mocked "execute"
method of os-brick *without* specifying the return value. This lead
to an exception in the safe_decode() method as it isn't able to
decode MagicMocks:
    TypeError: <class 'mock.mock.MagicMock'> can't be decoded

This change adds return values to the mocked "execute" method which
can be decoded safely.

This change can not be cherry picked from the newton and ocata fixes
(dc84c1de76e51487c8b7a72ba623c12ee2747879) due to refactoring of the
test_volume unit test files.

Co-Authored-By: Markus Zoeller <mzoeller@de.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I9b0a6c5be41c471d1a7782f77927ffe3b9652043
Closes-Bug: 1638861
(cherry picked from commit 753a147768be3ea9813f45c6adc414df69f50dee)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unit tests for LVM migration with os-brick 1.7.0

Commit a9f50dd3823ea2e9c568a1fdd970e268955dca9f in os-brick 1.7.0
introduced the usage of safe_decode() of the results of CLI commands.
This revealed that two unit tests in Cinder use a mocked "execute"
method of os-brick *without* specifying the return value. This lead
to an exception in the safe_decode() method as it isn't able to
decode MagicMocks:
    TypeError: <class 'mock.mock.MagicMock'> can't be decoded

This change adds return values to the mocked "execute" method which
can be decoded safely.

This change can not be cherry picked from the newton and ocata fixes
(dc84c1de76e51487c8b7a72ba623c12ee2747879) due to refactoring of the
test_volume unit test files.

Co-Authored-By: Markus Zoeller <mzoeller@de.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I9b0a6c5be41c471d1a7782f77927ffe3b9652043
Closes-Bug: 1638861
(cherry picked from commit 753a147768be3ea9813f45c6adc414df69f50dee)

commit_message:
Cascade deletes of RP aggregate associations

Currently when we delete a resource provider, the associations it has to
aggregates are not also deleted. This patch adds the deletion of all
ResourceProviderAggregate associations for that RP.

Closes-Bug: #1647697

Change-Id: I47ebd1464256f2fbc7505a5c1b3c74a4ba89ccf0

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-08 16:56:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/objects/resource_provider.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_resource_provider.py'], 'message': 'Make resource provider objects not remotable

The intent is for the resource provider objects to never be used
outside the placement API and for the placement HTTP API to be the
only remote interface to the information represented by the objects.
Therefore there is no need for the versioned objects that provide
the interface between the HTTP API and the database API to be
remotable.

This change removes the remotable decorators and updates tests
accordingly. The objects which have changed have had their versions
updated to provide a marker in their history to indicate that it
happened.

Change-Id: Ic2b431c8ba0af2dea4117687c7ef9477a6655bcf
'}]
commit_message:
Make resource provider objects not remotable

The intent is for the resource provider objects to never be used
outside the placement API and for the placement HTTP API to be the
only remote interface to the information represented by the objects.
Therefore there is no need for the versioned objects that provide
the interface between the HTTP API and the database API to be
remotable.

This change removes the remotable decorators and updates tests
accordingly. The objects which have changed have had their versions
updated to provide a marker in their history to indicate that it
happened.

Change-Id: Ic2b431c8ba0af2dea4117687c7ef9477a6655bcf

commit_message:
Bumping Keystoneauth1 version to 2.16.0

Keystoneauth1 has implemented feature to pass service token along
with user token for long running processes. This will mitigate issue
with expired user token. We need to use this in nova.

Nova changes: I51eb0a8937fa39a2e5dafb1ad915e7113ea61f72

Change-Id: I788db2d8846ea1a2205f0dccda8d308fe49102ae
Implements: bp use-service-tokens

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-25 06:49:02.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/clients/os/nova.py', 'heat_integrationtests/scenario/test_server_signal.py', 'heat_integrationtests/scenario/templates/test_server_signal.yaml'], 'message': "Do not set the mime-type for userdata

We set the mime-type to  'x-shellscript' for all
single userdata when user_data_format='SOFTWARE_CONFIG',
it's incorrect, for example, if user create a server
with a cloud-config userdata, we will set the mime-type to
'x-shellscript', then cloud-init will consume the userdata
as a shellscript and fail to execute.

This change will improve this by not setting the mime-type
and letting cloud-init figure it out from the first line
in the file.

Closes-Bug: #1643739
Change-Id: If026884a95c58bb81a0f04ab415909011b1a5414
"}]
commit_message:
Do not set the mime-type for userdata

We set the mime-type to  'x-shellscript' for all
single userdata when user_data_format='SOFTWARE_CONFIG',
it's incorrect, for example, if user create a server
with a cloud-config userdata, we will set the mime-type to
'x-shellscript', then cloud-init will consume the userdata
as a shellscript and fail to execute.

This change will improve this by not setting the mime-type
and letting cloud-init figure it out from the first line
in the file.

Closes-Bug: #1643739
Change-Id: If026884a95c58bb81a0f04ab415909011b1a5414

commit_message:
Fix error when system uses /usr/bin/qemu-kvm, as in CentOS 7.2.

Got "libvirt.libvirtError" error when using "/usr/bin/qemu-kvm" on CentOS7.2.
CentOS 7.2 uses "/usr/libexec/qemu-kvm", this patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Icf2951701fddfac8e2f0641f6f555adb8a3c185b
Closes-Bug: #1649449

subject: Add support when creating multiple databases with same db username
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-14 11:58:47.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/db/mysql/user.pp', 'spec/defines/openstacklib_db_mysql_host_user_spec.rb', 'manifests/db/mysql/host_access.pp', 'spec/defines/openstacklib_db_mysql_host_access_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Add support when creating multiple databases with same db username

when creating mutiple databases like "designate",
"designate_pool_manager" with same db username in designate fuel plugin
 and the plugin makes use of puppet-openstaclib (::openstacklib::db::mysql)
so it will raise error:
  duplicate declaration: Mysql_user[designate@localhost] is already declared
in file /etc/puppet/modules/openstacklib/manifests/db/mysql/host_access.pp:33.

so we can try to set mysql_user as a virtual resource, and provide support for
the scenario by realizing virtual resource many times.

Change-Id: Ifc2b7c4720d2e6f79dc49cf8811378cfb24964be
Closes-Bug: #1612093
'}]
commit_message:
Add support when creating multiple databases with same db username

when creating mutiple databases like "designate",
"designate_pool_manager" with same db username in designate fuel plugin
 and the plugin makes use of puppet-openstaclib (::openstacklib::db::mysql)
so it will raise error:
  duplicate declaration: Mysql_user[designate@localhost] is already declared
in file /etc/puppet/modules/openstacklib/manifests/db/mysql/host_access.pp:33.

so we can try to set mysql_user as a virtual resource, and provide support for
the scenario by realizing virtual resource many times.

Change-Id: Ifc2b7c4720d2e6f79dc49cf8811378cfb24964be
Closes-Bug: #1612093

commit_message:
Support purge queue -- wsgi

A new endpoint /v2/queues/myqueue/purge is added to support purge
a queue, which accepts a POST body like:
{"resource_types": ["messages", "subscriptions"]} to allow user
purge particular resource of the queue. Test cases are added as
well.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Partially Implements: blueprint purge-queue

Change-Id: Ie82713fce7cb0db6612693cee81be8c3170d292a

commit_message:
Fix dot issue in field name

In Elasticsearch 2.0 field names cannot contain '.', so when indexing
document with property contains '.' in field name, it will fail with
error: "cannot contain '.'".

Change-Id: Idf954f7a427dd78c40bdeb8fecba71387e6c5a3d
Closes-bug: #1622343

commit_message:
Set max_size to cfg.CONF.max_nodes_per_cluster if -1.

Since we need to calculate with max_size in scaling_policy[1].
but it always get negative num in[1] when max_size = -1,
we need to set it cfg.CONF.max_nodes_per_cluster

[1] https://github.com/openstack/senlin/blob/master/senlin/policies/scaling_policy.py#L192

Change-Id: I308d6f9ce15e6655fe541775e5459abd5aa2cc31

commit_message:
Use liberty-eol tag for liberty release notes

reno doesn't currently handle missing branches so we need
to use the liberty-eol tag to fix the release note job in
the gate now that origin/stable/liberty is gone.

reno will eventually check for the -eol tag when a stable
branch isn't found in:

I41ab682f081e7fd39ea534b7e2180c2109ca34ef

Change-Id: Ie54f69f5c1f91a3781c876f035fe9ed838e11c08

commit_message:
Use liberty-eol tag for liberty release notes

reno doesn't currently handle missing branches so we need
to use the liberty-eol tag to fix the release note job in
the gate now that origin/stable/liberty is gone.

Change-Id: I33745679b6eff64922b96a38071c4f9f68a6a41d
Closes-bug: #1650081

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-05 19:18:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/test_replication_manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix replication_status on InvalidReplicationTarget

When we cannot do a replication failover because the driver raises an
InvalidReplicationTarget exception we revert the replication status from
"failing-over" to its previous status.

Since we are not saving the previous status we were deciding what it was
based on the requested secondary_backend_id, which is wrong, as it
assumes we cannot failover from one secondary to another secondary.

This patch fixes this by changing the deciding factor from the
secondary_backend_id to the current backend_id in the service.

We had no failover_host manager tests, and this patch doesn't try to add
all the tests that we should have, it just adds the tests pertinent for
this patch to avoid regressions and test this specific functionality.

Closes-Bug: #1641715
Change-Id: I5a911278aef8060e14577099b0e03daf2039a783
'}]
commit_message:
Fix replication_status on InvalidReplicationTarget

When we cannot do a replication failover because the driver raises an
InvalidReplicationTarget exception we revert the replication status from
"failing-over" to its previous status.

Since we are not saving the previous status we were deciding what it was
based on the requested secondary_backend_id, which is wrong, as it
assumes we cannot failover from one secondary to another secondary.

This patch fixes this by changing the deciding factor from the
secondary_backend_id to the current backend_id in the service.

We had no failover_host manager tests, and this patch doesn't try to add
all the tests that we should have, it just adds the tests pertinent for
this patch to avoid regressions and test this specific functionality.
Missing tests should be added in another patch.

Closes-Bug: #1641715
Change-Id: I5a911278aef8060e14577099b0e03daf2039a783

commit_message:
Make ICMPResponder work for all router interfaces

To make ICMPResponder work for all router interfaces, the icmp flows
should have higher priorities then l3 flows. And there should be flows
to match icmp request from all subnets to router interface.

This patch adds the icmp flows, which are for cross subnets packets,
to L3_LOOKUP_TABLE.

Change-Id: I9f9fcf368aa61397242590b2edc1d04479811fba
Closes-Bug: #1635494

subject: Default libvirt_cpu_mode to none when using qemu
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-14 17:21:43.000000000', 'files': ['test-environments/multinode.yaml', 'test-environments/worker-config.yaml', 'test-environments/worker-config-mitaka-and-below.yaml'], 'message': "Default libvirt_cpu_mode to none when using qemu

An upcoming update to qemu-kvm (2.6.0) with CentOS/RHEL 7.3 can break
existing implementations where qemu is the configured hypervisor and
'host-model' is used.
As such, ensure libvirt_cpu_mode is set to none when qemu is in use.

Worth noting that devstack has been setting 'none' [1] as well.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/1c442eebc8fe005af453bd610e750a1919a2b3ed/lib/nova_plugins/hypervisor-libvirt#L42

Change-Id: I4a7c3ced59c46fb2582122260922813b09a3d042"}]
commit_message:
Default libvirt_cpu_mode to none when using qemu

An upcoming update to qemu-kvm (2.6.0) with CentOS/RHEL 7.3 can break
existing implementations where qemu is the configured hypervisor and
'host-model' is used.
As such, ensure libvirt_cpu_mode is set to none when qemu is in use.

Worth noting that devstack has been setting 'none' [1] as well.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/1c442eebc8fe005af453bd610e750a1919a2b3ed/lib/nova_plugins/hypervisor-libvirt#L42

Change-Id: I4a7c3ced59c46fb2582122260922813b09a3d042

commit_message:
Moving Reboot bashscript to python

Currently a reboot bash script file is used to call reboot and
poweroff operation. Deleting this file and moving the code to
python file using utils.execute()

Partial-Bug: #1557542

Change-Id: Iad9cd9d15417e9a954d108d2759e6303452fca27
Author: Bharath kumar <shettybharath4@gmail.com>

subject: Avoid printing traceback if VM is not HA_Enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-14 13:32:09.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/engine/drivers/taskflow/base.py'], 'message': "Avoid printing traceback if VM is not HA_Enabled

While executing instance failure workflow, if instance is
not HA_Enabled then it will gracefully exit the taskflow by
raising an exception which outputs the traceback in logs.

Added a new class SpecialFormatter, inherited from
'taskflow.formatters.FailureFormatter' and overridden its
'format' method to avoid logging traceback of specified
exceptions in the logs.

NOTE:
Removed the '_format_failure' method as it is no longer
exists in taskflow.

Closes-Bug: #1647115
Change-Id: Ida35d33de2d14cab17a3c485481cf50d67084347
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid printing traceback if VM is not HA_Enabled

While executing instance failure workflow, if instance is
not HA_Enabled then it will gracefully exit the taskflow by
raising an exception which outputs the traceback in logs.

Added a new class SpecialFormatter, inherited from
'taskflow.formatters.FailureFormatter' and overridden its
'format' method to avoid logging traceback of specified
exceptions in the logs.

NOTE:
Removed the '_format_failure' method as it is no longer
exists in taskflow.

Closes-Bug: #1647115
Change-Id: Ida35d33de2d14cab17a3c485481cf50d67084347

subject: Stop instance only if it's HA_Enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-14 13:33:59.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/engine/drivers/taskflow/instance_failure.py'], 'message': "Stop instance only if it's HA_Enabled

Moved instance HA_Enabled check before stopping the instance.
The reason is because end user manages high availability of
instances by themselves without relying on operator provided
HA feature. If instance is not HA_Enabled then masakari-engine
shouldn't stop the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1649193
Change-Id: Id8bc934e1d5018433c6fd09c3c2334f3eead2431
"}]
commit_message:
Stop instance only if it's HA_Enabled

Moved instance HA_Enabled check before stopping the instance.
The reason is because end user manages high availability of
instances by themselves without relying on operator provided
HA feature. If instance is not HA_Enabled then masakari-engine
shouldn't stop the instance.

Closes-Bug: #1649193
Change-Id: Id8bc934e1d5018433c6fd09c3c2334f3eead2431

Change-Id: I65b552c2ea7311d4e9707a4b2788be18e363ad08

commit_message:
Add ironic-staging-drivers to projects

This project already has check-requirements job specified in project-config
but was not added to this list, so there were no requirements syncs.

As it is a suit of "plugins" for ironic, its requirements are better to
be in sync with ironic's ones.

Change-Id: I65b552c2ea7311d4e9707a4b2788be18e363ad08
